instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Anti-Glare LCD Macbook repair
threads.message:
Hello !
I understand this is for Logic Board repairs, however I wanted to ask a question on repairing the Anti Glare issue on the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'s MBP.
Has anyone found a product that will repair the Anti Glare issue THAT WILL NOT damage the LCD below with liquid damage ?
Appreciate the feedback ?
Cheers Hutch CGB.

threads.title: Anti-Glare LCD Macbook repair
threads.message: thick toilet bleach works. use minimal effort and non-abrasive wipes, there is a professional product called armour etch but why over complicate things as it is not available everywhere.

threads.title: Anti-Glare LCD Macbook repair
threads.message:
I bought it half year ago.
Personally I didn't use it yet, but I have recommended to other friend and he said is good enough.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.viniloytransfer.com/cremas-y-kits-grabado-de-cristal/171-crema-para-grabar-cristal-armour-etch-80-gramos.html[/URL]
It was also recommended to me by other friend.
So I have two confirmations...

threads.title: Anti-Glare LCD Macbook repair
threads.message: Thanks guys, I really appreciate the effort in replying.  Cheers Hutch

threads.title: Anti-Glare LCD Macbook repair
threads.message: Confirmation guys, the Acid Etch product works great. Much Appreciated. HUTCH.
